title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,958.90 USD/T on December 19, 2025, up 1.47% from the previous day, with a 5.20% increase over the past month and 16.35% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures hovered around $2,890 per tonne near a one-month high, supported by improving demand prospects, tight global supply, and China's fresh stimulus measures against its property crisis.

title: Global aluminum ingot prices tumble in Q2 2025 amid tariffs, oversupply and weak demand
summary: The Asia-Pacific Aluminium Ingot Price Index fell 8.1% in Q2 2025 due to weak downstream demand and steady supply, with North America seeing an 18% drop from tariffs and oversupply. Recent regional price updates include Hangzhou, Nanchang, and Foshan on Dec 22. Looking ahead, LME aluminum prices are forecasted to rise 6.3% year-on-year to around USD 2,573 per tonne amid potential supply shortfalls and demand from EVs and infrastructure.

title: SHFE and LME aluminium prices strengthen in sync, and insufficient fundamental support awaits observation
summary: LME aluminium closed at USD 2,955.5 per tonne after hitting a high of USD 2,960, while SHFE aluminium 2602 contract closed up 0.27% at RMB 22,245 per tonne. Central China market saw weakening sentiment with tepid downstream buying, though some trader purchases occurred. Secondary aluminium alloy prices rose 0.59%, but volatility suppresses demand.

title: Aluminum Hovers Near 1-Month High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK hovered around $2,890 per tonne, close to the one-month high reached on December 5th, supported by improving demand prospects and tight global supply. China has signaled fresh stimulus measures to combat its property crisis, which could boost demand for industrial metals. The world's top producer is expected to approach its 45-million-ton annual cap, leaving limited room for further production growth.

title: A Pivotal Week Hints at How the Aluminium Value Chain May Be Reshaped
summary: IB2 opened its first large-scale aluminium production factory in Liulin, Shanxi, China, with innovative technology that transforms low-grade bauxite into high-quality feedstock. Vedanta Aluminium expanded its Lanjigarh alumina refinery in Odisha to a capacity of 5 million tonnes per annum, making it the second-largest alumina refinery outside of China. China saw a 14 percent drop in imports of unwrought aluminium and aluminium products in November 2025 compared to the same month last year.

title: Nonferrous Metals Surge Over 75% Year-to-Date; U.S. Rate Cut Impacts
summary: Capacity utilization rates for primary aluminum are nearing full production limits, with mainstream social stockpiles of primary aluminum at a historically low level of 584,000 metric tons on December 11. Aluminum demand remains resilient in new energy and power sectors, with sustained demand release in sectors like air conditioner heat exchangers and new energy vehicle battery trays. Aluminum prices are likely to recover alongside copper as supply-demand dynamics tighten.

title: 2025 Aluminum Scrap Market Review: Tariffs, Fires, and a Challenging Year
summary: The U.S. aluminum scrap market faced significant challenges in 2025 due to tariff increases and supply disruptions, including multiple fires at the Novelis aluminum plant in Oswego, New York, which produces over a billion pounds of aluminum sheet annually. The Section 232 tariff increase from 25 percent to 50 percent drove the Midwest premium to historical levels and changed supply/demand balances. Industry outlook for 2026 suggests early catch-up time for mills with hopes for stability by the end of the first quarter.

title: What Technological Innovations Will the Aluminum Industry See in 2025?
summary: The aluminum industry is experiencing significant technological breakthroughs in 2025, with inert anode technology leading the way. This innovation replaces traditional carbon anodes with inert anodes in aluminum electrolysis, emitting oxygen instead of greenhouse gases and achieving complete decarbonization. RUSAL has successfully employed this technology to produce high-purity aluminum with carbon emissions of less than 0.01 tons of CO₂ equivalent per ton of aluminum.

title: Aluminum's Impact on Sustainable Development Goals
summary: This article explores how aluminum drives sustainable development through recycling innovation and energy efficiency, with particular focus on electric vehicle applications. The analysis projects 5-15% price premiums for verified sustainable aluminum products and identifies key investment opportunities in recycling infrastructure, technology innovation, and renewable energy integration for aluminum production.

title: ELYSIS Hits Milestone: First Inert Anode Aluminum Cell
summary: ELYSIS announced the successful startup of its 450 kiloampere inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's smelter in Alma, Quebec, marking the first commercial-scale implementation of this technology. This breakthrough enables high-amperage aluminum production with no direct carbon emissions from the smelting process while improving worker safety, reducing costs, and enhancing productivity.

title: Startup makes game-changing breakthrough that could transform aluminum recycling
summary: Sortera, an Indiana-based tech company, secured $45 million in funding to expand its aluminum recycling operations with a new facility in Tennessee. The company uses artificial intelligence and advanced sensors to sort mixed aluminum scrap with over 95% accuracy without requiring pre-melting, significantly improving recycling efficiency and enabling the creation of high-purity recycled metal feedstocks.

title: Building reuse into the materials around us
summary: MIT researchers highlight advances in aluminum recycling through automated sensor-based sorting, machine learning, and robotics that enable aluminum scrap to be directed into higher-value applications including aerospace components and structural automotive parts. The research demonstrates how advancements in circular economy practices can extract value from industrial waste while reducing energy consumption in alloy production.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup energy technology was selected from over 70 proposals to provide clean, scalable backup power systems for data centers. The technology will be scaled to the megawatt level and deployed in live environments at hub member data centers as a sustainable alternative to diesel generators.

title: AKFA Aluminum to Build First U.S. Facility in Kentucky
summary: AKFA Aluminum announced an $80 million investment to build its first U.S. facility in Kentucky, creating 331 jobs and introducing new aluminum extrusion, anodizing, and finishing capacity. The facility will operate as a full-cycle production hub integrating recycled aluminum billets and energy-efficient equipment to support a lower-carbon supply chain.

title: Aluminium at Climate Week NYC 2025
summary: The aluminum sector participated in Climate Week NYC 2025, with industry leaders including Alcoa CEO Bill Oplinger discussing industrial strategy in an era of geopolitical and climate uncertainty. The sector emphasized that decarbonizing primary aluminum production and scaling up recycling are essential to achieving net zero goals.

title: Aluminum giants hit major milestone with low-carbon production
summary: Elysis, a joint venture of Alcoa and Rio Tinto, announced a breakthrough in scaling its carbon-free inert anode technology to commercial viability. This milestone represents a major step forward in reducing carbon emissions from primary aluminum production at scale.

title: U.S. Recycled Steel Prices Rise in December 2025 After Subdued Period
summary: U.S. recycled steel prices increased in December 2025 following a subdued market from May through November. Davis Index reported a $10 per ton price increase for prime and prompt grades, with some shredded, plate, structural, and heavy melting steel grades rising $20 per ton. Severe weather disruptions in late November and early December contributed to construction slowdowns and material flow interruptions.

title: Steel Market Update - Price Movements and Chinese Production Data
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,069 CNY/T on December 19, 2025, down 0.49% from the previous day, though prices have risen 0.07% over the past month. Steel rebar futures climbed above CNY 3,080 per ton as expectations of improving steel margins among Chinese producers lifted sentiment, supported by falling input costs for coal and coke.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and Market Analysis
summary: SteelRadar provides comprehensive global iron and steel price tracking across major exchanges including Shanghai Futures, Turkey, China, Europe, and North America. The platform tracks rebar and billet prices with recent reports noting gradual declines in Turkey's long products market as of December 18, 2025.

title: Hot-Rolled Coil Prices Strengthen with Coke Price Reductions
summary: Hot-rolled coil prices strengthened this week with price reductions announced for wet-quenched coke (50 yuan/mt) and dry-quenched coke (55 yuan/mt), effective from December 22, 2025. The most-traded HRC contract gained 0.85% and settled at 3,305 yuan/mt.

title: U.S. Raw Steel Output Rises in Mid-December 2025, Says AISI Report
summary: U.S. raw steel production increased to 1.753 million net tons in the week ending December 13, 2025, up 5.3% year-on-year from 1.665 million tons, with capability utilization at 76.5%. Year-to-date production through that week reached 85.881 million net tons at 76.8% utilization. The Southern district led output at 815,000 tons, followed by Great Lakes and Midwest regions.

title: Domestic Steel Industry Dynamics 2026 & Falling LME ...
summary: The stainless steel market bulletin discusses dynamics entering late December 2025, with nickel prices on the LME dropping to around $14,500 per ton, easing cost pressures temporarily. It highlights policy, supply-demand, and raw material impacts shaping trends into early 2026. The update covers industrial metal price adjustments amid cautious investor sentiment.

title: CHAMPION IRON TO LAUNCH CASH TENDER OFFER TO ACQUIRE RANA GRUBER, RECEIVES FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM LA CAISSE AND A TERM LOAN COMMITMENT FROM SCOTIABANK
summary: Champion Iron announced a cash tender offer to acquire Rana Gruber, a producer of high-grade iron ore concentrate (upgraded to 65% Fe) primarily for European steel production. The deal is expected to boost revenue, EBITDA, and cash flows accretively while maintaining financial leverage, supporting decarbonization in steel via quality resources. Rana Gruber produced 1,867 thousand metric tons of iron ore in the prior year at a cash cost of $565 per ton.

title: December 22, 2025，Liberty Steel has successfully restarted the blast furnace at its Whyalla steelworks
summary: Liberty Steel successfully restarted its blast furnace at the Whyalla steelworks in Australia after a strategic three-week pause. This resumption supports ongoing steel production capacity at the facility. The update falls under ferrous metals news coverage.

title: SAIL Turns to Danieli For IISCO Plant Expansion
summary: Danieli announced it will supply key technologies for the Steel Authority of India Ltd.'s (SAIL) IISCO Steel Plant expansion in Burnpur, West Bengal. This upgrade supports modern steel production advancements amid sustainability pressures in the industry. The project aligns with ongoing innovations in steel technology for efficiency and reduced emissions.

title: Danieli to Upgrade voestalpine Wire Rod Austria’s Mill
summary: Danieli has been selected to upgrade voestalpine Wire Rod Austria’s mill in Donawitz, Austria. The upgrade involves key technologies enhancing production capabilities. It contributes to steel industry innovations focusing on efficiency and sustainability.

title: Copper Price Forecast for Next Week (22nd - 26th December 2025)
summary: Copper prices rose 2.71% to $11,880 per metric ton amid expectations of U.S. interest rate cuts and 50% tariffs on refined copper causing arbitrage and shortages in Europe and Asia. A mudslide at Indonesia’s Grasberg mine is expected to limit 300,000-500,000 tons of supply until mid-2026. MCX Copper shows a bullish trend, with forecasts for a moderately bullish week ahead.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper rose to 5.46 USD/Lbs on December 22, up 0.98% daily and 9.45% monthly, supported by strong demand from China and the US in sectors like electric vehicles, energy infrastructure, and AI investments. Futures held above $5.4 per pound near multi-month highs. Recent updates note rises on December 19 and earlier fluctuations.

title: Copper Prices Surge Despite Economic Slowdown, Structural Factors Cited
summary: LME copper prices rose to $11,886.23 per ton on December 19, up 37% year-over-year, driven by supply disruptions, low refining fees, and inventory distortions rather than manufacturing recovery. Experts highlight mine issues, tariffs, and limited new supply development. Citi forecasts $13,000-$15,000 per ton in early 2026 amid AI demand.

title: The Bank of Japan raised interest rates by 25 basis points as expected and LME copper fluctuated and closed higher last Friday [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper closed at $11,870.5/mt on Friday, up 1.22%, after fluctuating between $11,785.5 and $11,928/mt, while SHFE copper rose 0.91% to 93,560 yuan/mt. Bank of Japan rate hike and hawkish US Fed views tempered gains amid loose spot supply and cautious downstream demand. Prices face limited upside potential.

title: Chinese copper smelter and Antofagasta agree to record low fees
summary: A Chinese smelter and Antofagasta agreed to record low processing fees for copper concentrate in 2026, signaling tight supply conditions. This deal underscores ongoing pressures in the copper market amid global trends.

title: Copper nears US$12,000 a tonne as base metals rally
summary: Copper prices rallied up to 1.3% to $11,928 a tonne, approaching an all-time high and nearing $12,000, as part of a broader base metals surge. This reflects strong market momentum in industrial metals.

title: Copper Prices Surge Despite Economic Slowdown, Structural Factors Cited
summary: International copper prices have hit record highs, rising to $11,886.23 per ton on December 19th, marking a 37% increase from the end of last year. The surge is driven by supply disruptions, AI infrastructure demand, and limited development of new mines, with Goldman Sachs and Citi maintaining bullish outlooks projecting prices between $13,000-$15,000 per ton in early 2026.

title: Copper Rebounds on Short Covering
summary: Copper rose to 5.46 USD/Lbs on December 22, 2025, up 0.98% from the previous day, with prices remaining near multi-month highs. Strong demand from China and the US, driven by electric vehicles, energy infrastructure, and AI-driven investment, continues to support prices despite weak Chinese industrial data.

title: The Bank of Japan raised interest rates by 25 basis points as expected and LME copper fluctuated and closed higher last Friday
summary: LME copper closed at $11,870.5/mt on Friday with a 1.22% increase, while Chinese copper smelters and Antofagasta finalized 2026 copper concentrate long-term contract benchmark TC at record low fees. Global refined copper inventories reached a 35-year low of 1,451 thousand tons as of November 30, with supply constraints becoming increasingly prominent.

title: Nonferrous Metals Surge Over 75% Year-to-Date; U.S. Rate Cut
summary: Copper production capacity has been constrained by output reductions at Indonesia's Grasberg mine and production disruptions at Chilean copper companies, contributing to historically low global refined copper inventories. New energy vehicles and AI computing infrastructure construction have emerged as major growth drivers, with copper demand from EVs and charging piles growing significantly in 2025.

title: Nickel Prices Continue to Rebound
summary: Nickel prices continued their rebound momentum, with LME select nickel 3-month contracts rising to $14,935/mt, up $35 from the previous session. The strong recovery began on Wednesday, with the most-traded SHFE nickel contract 2601 settling at 117,180 yuan/mt on December 19, gaining 1.27% week-over-week.

title: Nickel Rose to 14,916.25 USD/T
summary: Nickel rose to $14,916.25 per ton on December 22, 2025, up 0.11% from the previous day. Over the past month, nickel prices have risen 1.26%, though the metal remains 2.93% lower than a year ago.

title: Nickel Price Extends Rebound After Indonesia Signals Mine Output Cut
summary: Nickel advanced for a third consecutive day, extending its rebound from an eight-month low after Indonesia proposed cutting nickel ore production in 2026 from 379 million tons to approximately 250 million tons. The metal rose as much as 1.5% on Friday, gaining more than 3% since closing at $14,263 on Tuesday, with analysts suggesting nickel is likely to outperform other base metals in 2026 if the production cut materializes.

title: Nickel price extends rebound after Indonesia signals mine output cut
summary: Indonesia, the world's top nickel producer, has proposed cutting nickel ore production to 250 million tons in 2026, down from 379 million tons this year, in response to a significant slump in nickel prices. The metal rose 1.5% on Friday following this announcement, extending a rebound from an eight-month low. Nickel prices have declined roughly 50% over the past three years due to oversupply from Indonesia and China outpacing global demand.

title: Eagle Mine sold
summary: Lundin Mining Corporation announced the sale of the Eagle Mine and Humboldt mill in Marquette County to Talon Metals Corp in an all-stock deal expected to close in early January. Eagle is currently the only primary U.S. nickel mine and produces nickel and copper concentrates, with the transaction allowing Talon to use cash flow from the mine to fund exploration and development of future mining operations.

title: Western Mines to restart Mulga Tank drilling next year
summary: Western Mines Group has completed diamond drilling at the Mulga Tank Project in Western Australia, reaching a depth of 1,437.5m with intersections of around 900m of magnesium oxide containing disseminated nickel sulphide mineralisation. The company plans to restart drilling mid-January 2026 to extend the hole and confirm the prospectivity of the nickel sulphide component, with x-ray fluorescence surveys returning up to 55% nickel at the prospect.

title: China's power reforms, global data centre buildout usher in battery boom
summary: Article discussing how China's power sector reforms and the global expansion of data centers are driving significant growth in battery technology and production.

title: LG Energy Solution's Groundbreaking Innovations at InterBattery 2025
summary: LG Energy Solution showcased cutting-edge battery innovations including high-voltage mid-nickel (HV Mid-Ni) pouch cells that reduce nickel content while increasing energy density, and won multiple awards for technological excellence at InterBattery 2025.

title: How 2026 will reshape the US critical mineral resilience
summary: Federal attention is shifting toward innovative metals processing technologies that break from traditional methods, with emphasis on sustainable and cost-effective approaches to strengthen domestic mineral capabilities and reduce reliance on overseas supply.
